titles.title: Armed Forces Citizenship Act of 2003
To revise the provisions of the Immigration and Nationality Act relating to naturalization through service in the Armed Forces, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration, Border Security, and Claims.

bill.summary: 5/6/2003--Introduced. Armed Forces Citizenship Act of 2003 - Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act respecting naturalization through service in the armed forces to: (1) reduce the required service from three years to one year (effective as if enacted on September 11, 2001); and (2) prohibit the imposition of a naturalization fee.Provides for overseas naturalization proceedings for members of the armed forces.
